results.title: Republicans Want Their Party to Unify Behind Donald Trump, Poll Shows
results.abstract: Even with the desire for unity, a New York Times/CBS News poll shows extraordinarily high levels of unpopularity for both Mr. Trump and Hillary Clinton.
results.byline: By JONATHAN MARTIN and DALIA SUSSMAN

multimedia.caption: Donald J. Trump with his family this month in New York.

results.title: What Would It Take for Donald Trump to Deport 11 Million and Build a Wall?
results.abstract: Mr. Trump’s proposal, which calls for deporting millions and building a wall along the southern border, is financially, scientifically and legally problematic, experts say.
results.byline: By JULIA PRESTON, ALAN RAPPEPORT and MATT RICHTEL

results.title: Hillary Clinton Says Donald Trump Is Not Qualified to Be President
results.abstract: Declaring herself the Democratic nominee, Mrs. Clinton said a number of her likely rival’s proposals prove how “unmoored” he is on foreign policy.

results.title: Bill Weld, Running as a Libertarian, Likens Donald Trump’s Immigration Plan to Kristallnacht
results.abstract: William F. Weld, the twice-elected former Republican governor of Massachusetts, has agreed to run for vice president with former Gov. Gary Johnson of New Mexico.
results.byline: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and THOMAS KAPLAN

results.title: EgyptAir Flight Believed to Have Crashed at Sea; Egypt Cites Possible Terrorism
results.abstract: Flight 804, carrying 66 people en route to Cairo from Paris, disappeared shortly before it was due to land. The reason was unclear, but the developments touched off fears about terrorism.
results.byline: By DECLAN WALSH and KAREEM FAHIM

results.title: EgyptAir Crash Blindsides a Nation That Thought It Was Recovering
results.abstract: For years, Egypt has been hit with crisis after crisis, devastating its economic lifeblood, tourism. But recently, there had been signs of a turnaround.

multimedia.caption: A relative of a passenger on EgyptAir Flight 804 inside a bus at the airport in Cairo on Thursday.
A relative of a passenger on EgyptAir Flight 804 inside a bus at the airport in Cairo on Thursday.

results.title: Oklahoma Passes Bill That Would Subject Abortion Doctors to Felony Charges
results.abstract: The State Senate measure, the first of its kind, would revoke such doctors’ medical licenses. The bill is on the desk of Gov. Mary Fallin.

multimedia.caption: State Senator Nathan Dahm, the sponsor of the bill in Oklahoma City on Tuesday, expressed hope that it would lead the Supreme Court to overturn Roe v. Wade.
State Senator Nathan Dahm, the sponsor of the bill in Oklahoma City on Tuesday, expressed hope that it would lead the Supreme Court to overturn Roe v. Wade.

results.title: San Francisco Forces Out Police Chief After Officer Kills Black Woman
results.abstract: Police Chief Gregory P. Suhr was asked to resign after the third killing since December involving the police force.
results.byline: By THOMAS FULLER and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS

results.title: Morley Safer, Mainstay of ‘60 Minutes,’ Is Dead at 84
results.abstract: Mr. Safer was on the CBS show for 46 years, and as a TV correspondent brought the horrors of the Vietnam War into America’s living rooms.

results.title: Stealing From Ebola to Fight Zika
results.abstract: The House voted to provide only about half of the emergency funds that the Senate did, and took the money away from other important programs.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

results.title: Aging in the Key of Humor
results.abstract: Michael Kinsley, the famed writer and editor, has Parkinson’s disease. Now he’s trying to guide baby boomers into old age.

results.title: Prosperous Mexican Farms Suck Up Water, Leaving Villages High and Dry
results.abstract: Scientists warn that as farms bore deeper into the aquifer they are reaching tainted water deposited between 10,000 and 35,000 years ago.

results.title: Pioneertown Wants to Be the New Old West
results.abstract: Founded in 1946 by a group of Hollywood legends like Roy Rogers and Gene Autry, the desert community is having something of a renaissance.

results.title: Another Chibok Schoolgirl Kidnapped by Boko Haram Is Found, Nigeria Says
results.abstract: The discovery of Serah Luka on Thursday was announced hours after Amina Ali, another kidnapping victim who was found Tuesday, met with President Muhammadu Buhari in the capital.
results.byline: By CHRIS STEIN and DIONNE SEARCEY

multimedia.caption: President Muhammadu Buhari of Nigeria, in glasses, met Amina Ali, one of nearly 300 girls kidnapped by Boko Haram in 2014, and her daughter on Thursday, two days after they were found.

results.title: You’ve Canceled the Wedding, Now the Aftermath
results.abstract: Wedding jitters have long been Hollywood material, but in real life it can be traumatic. Also, six tips on easing the financial and emotional pain.

results.title: ‘The Founder,’ Like Ray Kroc, Feasts on McDonald’s Imagery
results.abstract: The movie uses McDonald’s well-guarded iconography for a bold visual tour of the chain’s early days, but treads lightly in its promotional material.

results.title: Muirfield Golf Club Picks Discrimination Over the British Open
results.abstract: The vote against admitting women seems to come from a bygone century, one in which men and women didn’t coexist in boardrooms and government.
